repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Prevention and Management of
            Influenza Type Illness and Strengthening of Argentina's
            Epidemiological System Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Prevention and
            Management of Influenza Type Illness and Strengthening of
            Argentina's Epidemiological System Project for
            Argentina were as follows: outcome was satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome or global environment outcome was
            moderate, Bank performance was satisfactory, Borrower (of
            guaranteed loan) and implementing party performance was
            satisfactory, and Government performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: Argentina's adoption of
            a high-risk targeted vaccination strategy against A-H1N1
            influenza was effective in containing the epidemic. A
            comprehensive (human and animal) pandemic preparedness plan
            will benefit from moving from a response approach using
            emergency instruments to one that favors preventive risk
            reduction and risk management through regular country
            program and operations. High-risk groups can only be reached
            through an intense communication effort. Despite a short
            preparation period, it is important to avoid having tunnel
            vision and think broadly when designing emergency loans. The
            execution of projects within existing technical and
            administrative structures has significant positive
            externalities. A result-based financing (RBF) model is a
            valuable strategy to influence subnational government
            policies in federal systems. The World Bank should
            re-evaluate the objective of the emergency recovery loan
            instrument and its consistency with other fiduciary policies.

17981783.projn:
AR-Prevention And Management Of Influenza
            Type Illness And Strengt -- P117377

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Prevention and Management of
            Influenza Type Illness and Strengthening of Argentina's
            Epidemiological System Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Prevention and
            Management of Influenza Type Illness and Strengthening of
            Argentina's Epidemiological System Project is to
            strengthen the capacity of the Borrower's
            epidemiological health surveillance system to: a) prevent,
            monitor and evaluate influenza activity, and b) control
            epidemic waves of A/H1N1 influenza. The project was
            restructured to: process a partial cancelation of US$88
            million of the loan amount; and reallocate loan proceeds. A
            second restructuring was approved on March 9, 2012 to: 1)
            extend the project's closing date by 12 months from
            March 31, 2012, to March 31, 2013, 2) adjust the project
            indicators in table one of the emergency project paper, and
            3) reallocate loan proceeds. The extension will allow the
            project to achieve the targets of the two remaining Project
            Intermediate Outcome Indicators (PDIs): number of situation
            analysis rooms certified, and number of situation rooms that
            achieve a highly satisfactory level of accreditation at the
            end of the project (above 80 percent).

display_title.display_title:
Argentina - Prevention and
            Management of Influenza Type Illness and Strengthening of
            Argentina's Epidemiological System Project :
            restructuring : Main report

15956999.projn:
AR-Prevention And Management Of Influenza
            Type Illness And Strengt -- P117377

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Prevention and Management of
            Influenza Type Illness and Strengthening of Argentina's
            Epidemiological System Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Prevention and Management of Influenza Type Illness and
            Strengthening of Argentina's Epidemiological System
            Project is to support the Nation's high-level objective
            to reduce its burden of disease related to infectious and
            transmitted diseases, and specifically acute respiratory
            infections (ARI). The restructuring involves the: 1) extend
            the project's closing date by 12 months from March 31,
            2012, to March 31, 2013, 2) modify table one of the
            emergency project paper; and 3) reallocate loan proceeds.
            The restructuring will allow the project to fully achieve
            its targets. The extension is necessary to: a) integrate the
            pneumococcal vaccine campaign into the nation's regular
            vaccination schedule with the purpose of achieving the
            agreed 85 percent doses coverage; b) strengthen the capacity
            and quality of the Health Situation Rooms (HSR) to
            contribute to the public health intelligence system,
            upgrading the 'certification' through a second
            'accreditation' process; c) improve the monitoring
            of project performance; d) strengthen the country's
            mobile emergency and urgency system, by completing the
            ongoing procurement process for ambulances; and e) complete
            impact evaluation and ongoing operational research on
            strategies for vaccination and epidemiological surveillance,
            ensuring the project's lessons will be identified and
            disseminated. This is the project's first extension.
